radiographic_examinations.findings: Bone age of 15 years with unfused metacarpal and phalangeal epiphyses.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Bone age did not show any change until phase 5, where it was observed to increase to 16 years after 6 months of transdermal estradiol treatment.

radiographic_examinations.findings: BMD in phase 1 showed a pattern of osteoporosis.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: BMD increased slightly at the lumbar spine after 14 months of testosterone treatment, and significantly after 6 months of estradiol treatment, reaching values that were maintained during the subsequent treatment.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Echo-Doppler study of the carotid arteries
radiographic_examinations.findings: Two lipid plaques in the left common and internal carotid of 4 mm and 3 mm thickness, respectively.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Plaque sizes reduced to 2.5 mm and 2 mm after 6 months of transdermal estradiol treatment, followed by complete disappearance of the plaques.
Improvement of liver function and morphology was observed during estradiol treatment.
